This drop down has the EPICs that are part of the project. Similarly, I would like to have the ‘Feature Link’ inside the story to appear as a drop down with the list of features created within the selected EPIC.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a JSON import is already in progress and another JSOM import is attempted one will see the progress of the ongoing import instead of a new one.

This is confusing and can cause the first import to become cancelled by mistake thinking something is wrong with the importer 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a large JSON import
# While this import is in progress, open a new tab and attempt a second import
# Notice you are mistakenly viewing the first import after selecting begin import on the second one

h3. Expected Results
A new import is performed 

h3. Actual Results
The first import's progress is shown

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JSON importer does not check for imports already in progress

fields.description:
Lists that include more than 15 projects which are shared by a scheme only list the first 15 and mention "and X hidden project" for the remaining amount. See below for reference:

!scheme.png|thumbnail!

There should be an option or way to configure the number of project displayed or list all of them.
fields.summary: List of projects that share a scheme limited to 15

fields.description:
The "Add users to a role" form shows the list of available roles sorted alphabetically, and when you fill in a username, the first available role is automatically selected.  But because people are lazy, they often don't bother to choose a different role or don't realize they have to.  This leads to way too many users being in the first role even if that's not appropriate...like "Administrators", which has the unfortunate property of usually being the first in an alphabetically sorted list.

 

Suggestions:
 * Make it possible to choose a different default than the first entry, and/or
 * Make the form not automatically select the first entry, and/or
 * Make it possible to choose a different sort order for the list

At the moment we are using the inelegant workaround of creating a role called "! NOT A REAL ROLE DON'T USE" just so it comes first in the list and indicates its (non-)purpose.
fields.summary: "Add users to a role" shows only alphabetically sorted list, but should offer other options

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the limit for this table "ID" column is *2147483647* due to its INT data type. But, due to the amount of operation that will create a new row into the table, the bigger the Repositories that are connected through DVCS the ID will soon reach its limit and the effect of this will be the DVCS Sync to be not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Several suggestions that I could provide is to:
# Change the Column ID Data Type to BIGINT to hold a bigger amount of Rows.
# There is a cleaning job that will remove older rows so it could be used again.
fields.summary: Better scaling for "AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_TAG" table

fields.description:

h3. Suggestion

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
h5. Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a issue (in our screenshot TEST-22) with a link to another issue (TEST-23 in our screenshot).
 2. Click on the http-link to the linked issue.
 3. Click on Browserback to get back to the original issue
 4. Press dot and type reporter or assignee into the popup
h5. Expected Behavior
 * The popup should only offer the operation "Edit field" of the requested field on the current issue.

h5. Actual Behavior
 * The popup offers the operation "Edit field" of the requested field for both issues: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * This can even be further stacked if each issue is linked to another issue:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h5. Cause
 * Unknown

h5. Workaround
 * Not to use the web browser navigation to go 'Back'.

h5. Notes:
 * Browser independent (tested in Chrome 61, IE 11, Firefox 52 and Safari 10)
 * After the quick options gets mixed up, if you attempt using any of the options in the list, nothing happens.

fields.description:
From Jira7.5, find-polyfill.js is added to provide Array.prototype.find() for old browsers(ex. IE11).

But Array.prototype.find() in this implementation can't be overridden .
 Our add-on don't work because the library we use overrides Array.prototype.find() in a subtype of Array.

 

We hope to be able to override 'find' function like [this way|https://github.com/Financial-Times/polyfill-service/blob/master/polyfills/Array/prototype/find/polyfill.js].

Also we think Jira had better to do so for the following reasons,
 # The polyfill library(such as babel-polyfill) [latest ReactJS|https://github.com/facebook/react/releases/tag/v16.0.0] encourages is *overridable*
 # Though modern browsers have native implementation for Array.prototype.find(), they all are *overridable*
fields.summary: Can't override Array.prototype.find()

This request is for the ability to clear Jira's internal caches in the admin section, much like Confluence's cache management feature

fields.description:
Good scrum practice is to assign a sprint goal.  When doing daily scrum meetings, we look at the scrum board, which has the title at the top.  It would be a good reminder every day to have the sprint goal right there under the title.

We can do that to some extent by changing the title, but we want the titles to remain 'team name sprint n' – sprint goal should be a separate field, displayed prominently at the top of the active sprint view.
fields.summary: Would like to have a field for 'sprint goal' that displays just under sprint title

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customizing JIRA Software and Core US and UK language packs are not possible in JIRA 7.4.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/
 # Locate the individual JIRA Core and JIRA Software files

h3. Expected Results

Files found should be similarly named
 - JIRA Core-7.4.1-language-pack-en_US.jar
 - JIRA Software-7.4.1-language-pack-en_US.jar

h3. Actual Results

The files are not in atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/ and have been replaced by
 - jira-languages-7.4.1-en_US.jar
 - jira-languages-7.4.1-en_UK.jar

h3. Workaround
 # Use atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-languages-7.4.1-en_UK.jar as a starting place as it has more preexisting translations than the US version
 # Extract the JAR
 # The {{JiraWebActionSupport_en_UK.properties}} that is extracted is used to customize the translations
 # In order to get translations to the US version, you can find them in the UK version and copy the line over to the US version
 -- For example,in the UK version we can find the key:
{code:java}
	common.concepts.watchers = Watchers
	{code}
  -- We can change this to = whatever we want, copy the line over to the US file and add the line(anywhere in the file) to change the translation on the US side.
 # Repackage the jar and place it into the atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins folder
 # When JIRA starts it will load these new modifications
fields.summary: Cannot customize US and UK JIRA Core and JIRA Software language packs in 7.4.1

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a field is set to the same value in both a transition screen and a workflow post function, the change will not show up in the issue's history.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure an "Update issue field" post function to set the "Resolution" field to "Done"
 # Configure the transition that resolves the issue to have a screen including the "Resolution" field;
 # Execute the above transition in a field, and set the "Resolution" field to "Done" on the screen;

h3. Expected Results
Issue history captures the change to the field.

h3. Actual Results
Issue history ignores the change, even though the actual field is updated to match the value set in the post function.
  
h3. Note
* This causes [JSD-4038|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4038];

h3. Workaround
Either remove the field from the transition screen or the post function from the workflow transition.
fields.summary: Field update is not captured in issue history if it is set to an equal value through a screen and a post function

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the user uses the JIRA Issue Calendar gadget, provided by the JIRA Calendar Plugin, it's possible to have a timezone unconformity when configuring the gadget with a DateField {{portlet.issuescalendar.field.dateFieldName.name}} set with the *Created* or *Updated* fields. These fields record timezone related information, and the gadget uses the JIRA`s Server system timezone instead of the Default user timezone or the User Preference Timezone (set by the user on his profile configuration). This is a problem when the JIRA's server system timezone is enough hours ahead of the user profile timezone that makes a few issues created on a specific day appear on the next day slot on the JIRA Issue Calendar gadget.

I.e.: JIRA's server system timezone: GMT and the User profile preference timezone: GMT -8. The user created an issue on October 3rd around 6PM PST, but the gadget shows the issue on the October 4th slot at 2AM since it adjusts to the server time instead of the user preference time.

Date fields that have no time component, such as *due dates*, release dates (associated with versions) and custom date fields, solely record date information (and no time zone-related information) so are not affected by time zone settings. So if the gadget is configured to use the *due date* field, the issues appear using the user profile preference timezone correctly.

h3. Problem

If JIRA's server system timezone is enough hours ahead of the user profile timezone that makes a few issues created on a specific day appear on the next day slot on the JIRA Issue Calendar gadget when the gadget is configured to use the Created or Updates DateFields.

h3. Cause

JIRA is using JIRA Server system timezone instead of JIRA User profile preferences timezone or JIRA Default user timezone (configured by the administrator) when the gadget is configured to use the Created or Updates DateFields.

h3. Workaround

- If it's possible, configure the gadget using the *due date* DateField configuration instead of any other field, and then configure JIRA user default timezone and the JIRA Profile Preferences timezone (for each user) to Los Angeles. The gadget will behave correctly.

- Or, if it's possible, the user can set the timezone for the Java environment on the setenv.sh file, forcing the system to use this timezone instead of the JIRA's server system timezone, although a few other problems might appear so be careful when changing this configuration.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/setting-the-timezone-for-the-java-environment-841187402.html
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Calendar Gadget timezone unconformity

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
JIRA doesn't respect _truststoreFile_ parameter in Tomcat's SSL connector.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
# Follow [Running JIRA applications over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-935391761.html] to configure JIRA to run over HTTPS using Tomcat SSL connector
# Modify the connector and add these parameters:
{code}truststoreFile="/path/to/truststore" truststorePass="changeit"{code}

h3. +Expected behavior+
JIRA respects the parameter and uses the specified path as truststore.

h3. +Actual behavior+
JIRA ignores the parameter and uses the default truststore instead (_JAVA_HOME/lib/security/cacerts_).

(!) This causes problems regarding [Connecting to SSL services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/connecting-to-ssl-services-935391760.html].

h3. +Workarounds for using custom/alternative truststore+
* Workaround 1 - Follow [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-935391828.html] to set this JVM parameter:
** Linux:
{code}-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=/path/to/truststore{code}
** Windows:
{code}-Djavax.net.ssl.trustStore=C:\path\to\truststore{code}
* Workaround 2 - Add this line to the bottom of _JIRA_Install/conf/catalina.properties_:
** Linux:
{code}javax.net.ssl.trustStore=/path/to/truststore{code}
** Windows (double backslashes):
{code}javax.net.ssl.trustStore=C:\\path\\to\\truststore{code}
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't respect truststoreFile when using Tomcat SSL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we try to create a new Software Project Space in Confluence, Jira Projects are not listed unless the user has "Create Issue" or "Work On Issues" Project permission in JIRA.


h3. Step to reproduce

# In Jira, grant only "Browse Projects" to a specific user/group/role, so that the user can view the projects and the issues within them, but cannot create issues;
# In Confluence, go to Spaces Menu and click on "Create space";
# Select "Software project space" and click on Next;

h4. Expected Result

User is able to see the projects as they do in JIRA and then creates the related Space in Confluence.

h4. Actual Result

The Project is not listed in Confluence, even though the user can browse it in JIRA.

In order to have the project shown up in Confluence, user must have "Create Issues" or "Work On Issues" permission in JIRA.


The problem is that some users might not edit information in a Project because of security reasons, but they can be responsible for creating the Software Project Space in Confluence.
fields.summary: JIRA requires inaccurate permission to create a software project space in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

(i) This issue has the same context and root cause as JRASERVER-44588 : Multi Select Custom Field loads options in a suboptimal way, but describes a different performance implication. JRASERVER-44588 discusses REST and DB performance on the JIRA server backend. This describes browser frontend performance.

In an environment which has a *Multi Select Custom Field* with very many options (at least 1000, but performance implications are more visible at larger numbers, such as 10,000), if said custom field is added to the *Create Issue* screen for a project, it is possible for the *Create Issue* popup dialog to become unresponsive when switching projects *from* said project associated with the custom field, to a different project.
h3. Environment

(!) Performance seems to be substantially worse in Google Chrome than in Firefox. (~17 seconds in Chrome vs ~2 seconds in Firefox in a fresh environment with a Multi Select Custom Field with 10,000 options)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new *Select List (multiple choice)* custom field
 # Add at least 1000 options, but recommended 10000 options to the field
 # Associate the custom field to at least one project's *Create Issue* screen
 # Navigate to a Dashboard
 # Click the *Create* button at the top of JIRA to bring up the *Create Issue* popup box
 # If not currently on a project with the custom field on it's Create Issue screen, change to one of those projects first.
 # Change projects away from the project associated with the custom field

h3. Expected Results

There will be no unresponsiveness, and the projects can be switched within a short period of time.
h3. Actual Results

The browser will be unresponsive while scripting is occurring, with the duration depending on the number of options being loaded and the performance of the browser's physical machine.

See [^JRASERVER-66086.mp4] for a demonstration of unresponsiveness in Google Chrome, along with Chrome's Performance Profiler results.
h3. Notes

The performance issue does not occur if trying to create an issue via *{{$JIRA_URL/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa}}*; only when using the popup window (i.e. when creating an issue from a Dashboard).
h3. Workaround

Use Firefox, as the performance issue appears to be either much less significant, or outright nonexistent.
fields.summary: Large number of options in Multi Select Custom Field hangs browser in Create Issue popup when changing projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

(i) This issue has the same context and root cause as JRASERVER-44588 : Multi Select Custom Field loads options in a suboptimal way, but describes a different performance implication. JRASERVER-44588 discusses REST and DB performance on the JIRA server backend. This describes browser frontend performance.

When adding a *Multi Select Custom Field* with very many options (at least 1000, but performance implications are more visible at larger numbers, such as 10,000) to the Basic Search functionality in JIRA's Issue Navigator, the Issue Navigator screen will become unresponsive for a significant period of time before returning control to the user. Attempting to click the custom field in question to expand it's dropdown will also trigger a period of unresponsiveness.
h3. Environment

(!) Performance appears to be worse in Google Chrome rather than Firefox, with Chrome experiencing unresponsiveness approximately 1.5 - 2x longer than Firefox does. (~8 seconds in Chrome vs ~5 seconds in Firefox in a fresh environment with a Multi Select Custom Field with 10,000 options)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new *Select List (multiple choice)* custom field
 # Add at least 1000 options, but recommended 10000 options to the field
 # Navigate to the Issue Navigator in *Basic Search*
 # Add said custom field to the Basic Search filter

h3. Expected Results

The custom field in question is added to the Basic Search criteria with no browser unresponsiveness
h3. Actual Results

The Issue Navigator will become unresponsive, with the duration depending on the number of options being loaded and the performance of the browser's physical machine.

See [^JRASERVER-66085.mp4] for a demonstration of unresponsiveness in Google Chrome, along with Chrome's Performance Profiler results.
h3. Workaround
 * Use Firefox for somewhat improved responsiveness.

 * Use Advanced Search and JQL to search instead.
 ** In JQL, after typing the custom field name and standing by for suggested results to populate, the browser will not freeze, but will still be processing the options. If given enough time, the suggested results will appear. At this time, these results will be cached and will be readily available for further searching until the cache expires or is refreshed.
fields.summary: Large number of options in Multi Select Custom Field hangs browser in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
As an Admin when adding Confluence Gadgets to JIRA, I would expect to log in and approve one token for every gadget that is added to JIRA. Similar to the behavior of current gadgets.

As of right now, whenever an external Confluence Gadget is added to JIRA, users must log in and approve each gadget that is added to the dashboard. While there is no issue with creating multiple keys, Users can find that managing tokens difficult.
fields.summary: Confluence external gadgets Should create and consume OAuth Access Token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are multiple required approvers added in a transition, Issue History and Activity is not updated until all approvers have approved the transition. It would be useful to have a history item set for each of the approves, so that the users would know when each approver has approved the issue for auditing purposes


h3. Suggested Solution
JSD should log each approvers action as a system event, and log a history event for each action applied by the individual approver, So that when the approval action is completed per user a timestamp is included for review and audit.
fields.summary: History should be set when each approver approves a transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Zero-width space inserted into version name in Release Hub when 11 characters long is copied and from pasted from IE11

h3. Environment
IE 11
JIRA 7.3.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a version whose name is at 11 characters long eg: {{12345678901}}
# Copy the name of the newly created version from the version list
# Paste the copied version name and create a new version with the same name


h3. Expected Results

JIRA should not allow you 

h3. Actual Results

* JIRA create a version with the same name. 
* However, when we try to query the two version in the basic search, then we see that the second version has a whitespace in it.
 
h3. Notes
# Works fine in Firefox, Chrome, Edge
# This only happens when copying. If the version {{12345678901}} is typed, then Jira will give an error that the version exists. 
# If you have a version name that is really long like {{thisisatestofaversionamethatisreallylong}}, then this is not reproducible as you cannot paste this on the field.
fields.summary: Zero-width space inserted into version name in Release Hub when 11 characters long is copied and from pasted from IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Selecting more than one cell of a table using the mouse cursor causes javascript errors in browsing console

h3. Environment
Reproduced in Chrome, IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a simple table such as the default template added when you add a table from the insert content menu (select table from + sign editor menu)
{code}
||Heading 1||Heading 2||
|Col A1|Col A2|
{code}
# Ensure you're now in Visual mode
# Enable developer tools and ensure the console tab is visible
# By dragging over cells with your mouse cursor, select up to 2 cells 

h3. Expected Results
Cells are highlighted by cursor without errors

h3. Actual Results
There are no issues in the application itself, but there are javascript errors thrown in the dev tools console {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'clearBars' of undefined}}
 
h3. Notes
* The underlying cause for this bug is a bug in the tinymce WYSIWYG editor https://github.com/tinymce/tinymce/issues/3260 which has been fixed in later versions of the editor
fields.summary: Java script error: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'clearBars' of undefined when selecting more than once cell of table in visual edit mode.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing a username in an external directory such as Active Directory will result in the user only being able to log into one node, specifically the node that last synchronized with external directory. The user will *not* be able to log into all other nodes

h3. Environment
* Jira Data Center with at least 2 nodes
* External directory configured

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup 2 nodes with Jira Data Center
# Configure an external user directory 
# Change a username in the external directory
# Synchronize user directory on node 1

h3. Expected Results
The user will be able to log into node 2

h3. Actual Results
The user cannot log into node 2 even after manually synchronizing the external directory on node 2

h3.Workaround
Restart all affected nodes
fields.summary: User cannot log in to most nodes after a username change in an external directory when using Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definitions:
When migration JIRA to another server, it does carry the information of the integrated External User Directories with it. But, it does not mean that the Directory will accept the request from the new Server. This will make the request to login will be rejected and there is no information in regards to this in the documentation. For example, Crowd needs the "Remote Addresses" to be set to allow authentication where migrating the server would have different Address.
- [Migrating JIRA applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/migrating-jira-applications-to-another-server-881683277.html]

h3. Suggested Solution:
To put more information in regards to the configuration of External User Directories that is connected to JIRA, for example, to check and change the necessary settings required whether it is from JIRA or the Directory itself after it is migrated.
fields.summary: More Information provided for connected External Directories

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

JIRA currently has add-on audit logs which logs when an add-on is installed, disabled, licensed, uninstalled as well as which user performed those actions. However, add up upgrade tasks labeled logged as an installation. 
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Update the audit logs to show add-on updates tasks as "Updates / Upgrades" instead of "installation"
h3. *Why this is important*

Administrators are able to track whether a add-on is installed or updated.
h3. *Workaround* 
 - none
fields.summary: Update add-on audit logs to show update tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA is unable to create a JIRA user account due to database rights, or if the database has an existing administrative user, JIRA will throw the "Cannot add user, all the user directories are read-only." error to reflect that it is unable to create the JIRA admin account.

h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to use a preconfigured admin account to install JIRA.
fields.summary: Ability to avoid "the cannot set up admin account error"

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+
Currently URL custom field type in JIRA only supports 255 characters. In many cases, URLs can easily exceed 255 characters (like JIRA batch.js and batch.css URLs). This makes it impossible to save the URLs in the field.

h3. +Suggestion+
Since it's very common for URLs to exceed 255 characters, this field type should support a bigger set of characters.

h3. +Failed Workaround+
URL field values are stored into column *stringvalue* of table *customfieldvalue*. The default character length of this column is 255. Increasing this length (by manually altering the column) won't help. This is due to the fix for JRASERVER-17811:
bq. UI catches the lengthy URL immediately and responds adequately with a `The entered text is too long. It exceeds the allowed limit of 255 characters.` message.

(i) This means, URLs longer than 255 characters are rejected by the GUI before JIRA attempts to write them to the database.

h3. +Other Workarounds+
Instead of URL field, considering using the followings:
# Web Link, from More -> Link (this field is always Optional)
# A multi-line Text field, which supports unlimited text, link rendering (via Wiki Style Render) and can be set as Required in Field Configurations
fields.summary: URL Field should support more than 255 characters

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
 * Captcha appears warped and unreadable and chart gadgets that print graphics show garbled text and weird symbols when running JIRA in Linux

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 * Attempt to login with captcha activated or add a gadget like the Pie chart gadget.

h5. Expected Behavior
 * Captcha is readable
 * Gadgets printing graphics and text have characters humanly readable.

h5. Actual Behavior
 * Captcha appears warped and completely unreadable:
 !CAPTCHA.PNG|thumbnail!
 * Gadgets with graphics print garbled characters:
 !image.png|thumbnail!

h5. Cause
 * Apparently, system fonts.

h5. Workarounds
 * Workaround 1
 ** Install the following packages (usually the fonts are enough but it is recommended to also include Ghostscript and Motif):
{code:java}
yum install ghostscript
yum install dejavu-fonts-common
yum install dejavu-sans-fonts
yum install dejavu-sans-mono-fonts
yum install motif{code}

 * Workaround 2
 ** It has been reported that, when already having the previously mentioned font packages, other font packages seem to interfere, specifically it has been mentioned that having installed lyx-fonts (Lyx/MathML fonts - A collection of Math symbol fonts for lyx) caused this issue, and removing the package solved it.

h5. Notes
 * This bug ticket has been raised due to JIRA requiring something to work that is not included in the installation package nor in the documentation as a requirement.

*Environment*
 * Linux RedHat
fields.summary: Captcha appears warped and unreadable and chart gadgets that print graphics show garbled text and weird symbols when running JIRA in Linux

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Gadget for *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* may cause high memory pressure in case it was built on a large data set and large dimensions were used.  

h3. Environment
* Large JIRA instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create JQL which returns a large data set 
# Add *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* to Dashboard and choose same parameter for X/Y axis. Parameter should have many values: eg Assignee, Versions, etc 
 !TwoDimensionalFilter_example.png|thumbnail! 
# Save gadget
#* If you press +Show more+ you can see more results, which leads to high memory consumption.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA performs well. If required it will limit the results set. 

h3. Actual Results
JIRA uses large amounts of memory 4GB+ which can lead to OOM.

h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Gadget for Two Dimensional Filter Statistics may cause high memory pressure in case of large dimension

fields.description:
Timing the startup sequence of a large Jira instance ( 2 million plus issues, thousands of custom fields, etc ) we discovered the various database and Lucene index checks take approximately 3 minutes out of a total startup time of 10 minutes. 

In a single-node environment this makes sense. In the case of Jira data center, with each node checking the database upon startup, perhaps less so.

This request is for the ability to bypass these checks with an environment variable. This would result in reducing startup time while leaving the checks in-place when needed for upgrades
fields.summary: Provide option to bypass database and Lucene index checks on Jira startup

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

JIRA currently has the option for setting default user settings upon user creation. However, for users that have been created, administrators are unable to perform bulk changes.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Provide a feature for administrator to force change all or selected existing user's current setting to a particular setting. Additionally, allow the administrator to prevent users from editing certain settings.
h3. *Why this is important*

Current solution in asking each user to do it cannot guarantee that the users changes the setting.
h3. *Workaround* 
 - none
fields.summary: Allow administrator to bulk edit user preference

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
The DVCS Connector shows a flat list of "unique commits" related to a JIRA issue. When you employ cherry-picking of commits into branches, the list will show the same commit messages for every branch due to the different commit hash, which is not really helpful, confusing, and costs a lot of time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Showing the branch name next to each commit, or group the commits by branch and display the branch on top would be useful when reviewing the commits that are related to the ticket. Besides running the cherry-picking command, there is still a possibility that there could be another commit with the same commit message.

See this example:
!display-branchnames.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: DVCS Connector: display branch names with commits

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The assignee picker can show duplicated users, compounding on multiple clicks of the assignee field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira instance with 15 or more users
# Create a project with an issue in it, and assign the issue to one of the users
# Change the assignee to another user, and refresh the issue
# Click the assignee field, and scroll down the list

h3. Expected Results
No users are duplicated.

h3. Actual Results
Some users will be duplicated in the list.

h3. Notes
There are multiple requests to the {{<base-url>/rest/api/latest/user/assignable}} endpoint. The rest endpoint is hit when clicking the "down" arrow, and when scrolling to the bottom of the list.

!duplicate-assignees.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Assignee picker shows duplicate users

fields.description:
The 'FileSystemInfo' health check tries to spawn the bash shell in order to determine ulimits. At least on Linux this is not necessary. ulimits can be determined by reading /proc/self/limits instead.

This matters in our environment as we apply a strict AppArmor profile to the JIRA process that disallows spawning a shell and so we get a lot of exceptions

java.io.IOException exceptions: Cannot run program "bash": error=13, Permission denied.
fields.summary: Check ulimits without spawning bash

fields.description:
*Summary*
When installing JIRA and going through setup wizard. 
* SetupLicense!default.jspa

Enter license key and include trailing space. Error appears

{quote}
We're unable to confirm that JIRA license

This license is invalid. Please double-check that you have entered it correctly, and contact Support if the issue continues.
{quote}

*Expected Behavior*
Trailing space is ignored. This was the behavior in previous versions. 
* Confirmed was space ignored in 7.2.10. Exact same entry was accepted without any errors

*Workaround*
Remove trailing space and resubmit. If problems persist try removing any line breaks and submit key as one long text string. 

*Notes*
The trailing space does not cause an error when submitting license on Versions & Licenses page
* /plugins/servlet/applications/versions-licenses
fields.summary: Trailing space causes license key error in setup wizard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA RTE has a few predefined colors that can be selected for font color. However, this cannot be configured to show custom default colors. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allows admins to define a custom default color scheme for font text. 

h3. Why this is important
Organizations may have corporate design guidelines, which would be needed to be followed 
 
h3. Workaround 
Other colors can be used by switching to Text mode and then in the 'color' tag, specify the HEX color code. 
{code}
{color:f1b695}My colored text{color}
{code}
which would be rendered as: 
{color:f1b695}My colored text{color}
This would not be convenient as users would have to use the text mode and note the HEX values, hence the feature request.
fields.summary: As a admin, I would like to have the ability to set the default colors available for font color in the Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
The [Making an Application Link the Primary Link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira060/making-an-application-link-the-primary-link-370705794.html] is misleading/ incorrect. A review needs to be done of how all the integration are effected by the primary status.
{quote} 
 Every time JIRA requests FishEye information (e.g. for a FishEye repository changeset), JIRA will request this information from the primary link's FishEye server. Note, both FishEye servers can still make requests of the JIRA server.
{quote}
All integration is the same with two instance of FishEye, despite how our documentation is worded.

!Screen Shot 2017-08-30 at 6.19.03 PM.png|thumbnail!

If you authenticated to FishEye/ Crucible at the bottom of the development panel screen from JIRA you can see commits from both instances. You can see from my screen shots, if I click on "127" (the name of my instance) it will bring me to an authentication page. Once I authenticate, I can go back to the development panel of the JIRA issue and see commits and reviews from both instance in the development panel.

!Screen Shot 2017-08-30 at 6.19.12 PM.png|thumbnail!

The "Primary Link" option doesn't have any effect from the JIRA side from what I can tell. Documenation should be updated to be clearer on that.
fields.summary: "Making an Application Link the Primary Link" is misleading.

h3. +Summary+
Users can't use Universal Plugin Manager to download / install add-ons.

h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Navigate to Manage add-ons page - /plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/
 # Try to install any add-on

h3. +Observed problem+
{panel:title=Error}
_Problem accessing the file ..._

!image-2017-09-27-10-26-27-043.png|thumbnail!
{panel}

h3. +Cause+
This issue is caused by a temporary domain name change for Marketplace add-ons. If your firewall rules only allow connections to marketplace.atlassian.com and marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com, you would be affected by this.

h3. +Workaround+
There is a temporary workaround available to whitelist marketplace-cdn.prod.public.atl-paas.net in Firewall rules in addition to marketplace.atlassian.com and marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com. *This is only temporary and can be removed after this issue is resolved.*

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating tickets/comments in JIRA via email, if an attachment is added to the email processed by JIRA, this attachment is added to the created/commented ticket as well.

For most attachment types, this is not a problem, but PDFs are failing to be previewed in the issue when added this way when using a Gmail account (not tested in others) as Email Server accessed by JIRA (not the user's source email).

This is happening because JIRA registered the ‘mime type’ for attachments in the ‘fileattachment’ table. All attachments added by email have a mime type in uppercase for some reason. 

For most attachments, this is not a problem, but JIRA is not able to preview PDFs with uppercase in mime type.


h3. Environment
This was only tested with Gmail in external emails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test Gmail account
# Create an Email Server connecting to the Gmail account and a handler to process the emails and create comments
# Send an email message with a PDF attached to the Gmail account to either create a new ticket or comment and existing one
# Navigate to the issue and click the PDF attachment

h3. Expected Results
The issue created/commented has a PDF attachment that when clicked previews the PDF in the browser (doesn’t download it).

h3. Actual Results
The PDF attachment is not identified as PDF, cannot be previewed and when clicked causes the file to be downloaded, not previewed.
 
h3. Notes
Here’s is the difference between a PDF added via email and added in the UI:
{code:sql}
jira=# select * from fileattachment where issueid in (select jiraissue.id from jiraissue join project on jiraissue.project = project.id where project.pkey = 'TP' and jiraissue.issuenum = 1);
   id | issueid | mimetype | filename | created | filesize | author | zip | thumbnailable 
------+---------+-----------------+--------------------------------+----------------------------+----------+----------+-----+---------------
10004 |   10000 | application/pdf | pdf_added_in_ui.pdf            | 2016-01-27 19:45:09.801-02 |    20597 | sysadmin |     |             0
10002 |   10000 | APPLICATION/PDF | pdf-attached_email.pdf         | 2016-01-27 19:30:41.117-02 |    20597 | admin    |     |             0
{code}

The first one can be previewed when clicked, while the second one when clicked in the issue is downloaded. 

Also, if you take a PDF that is working (can be preview and its mime type is in lowercase in the database) and change the mime type to uppercase and re-index JIRA, this PDF will have the same problem as the ones added by email. This shows that indeed the uppercase is what prevents these attachments from being previewed.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Mime types for email attachments are in uppercase and PDFs fail to be previewed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
From https://productsupport.adaptavist.com/browse/SRJIRA-2393:
bq. The problem is, even after changing the filter's ownership, the filter will continue to show up in the original owner's list of filters. The new owner can see it and use it normally, but the old owner gets a broken link in their "Manage Filters" screen. If the filter was a favorite, it will be in their list of favorites in the "Issues" drop-down, and it will be broken there too.

It appears calling the following Java API doesn't update filter caches as expected:
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.1.2/com/atlassian/jira/bc/filter/DefaultSearchRequestService.html#updateFilter-com.atlassian.jira.bc.JiraServiceContext-com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchRequest-

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Use SearchRequestService#updateFilter as described above in the Java API to change the owner of a search filter
* Login as the previous filter owner.
** The filter will continue to be visible under "Manage Filters" however the link is broken
** If this filter was a favorite as well it will appear under Favorites however the link is broken

h3. Expected behavior
After using SearchRequestService#updateFilter the previous owner no longer sees the filter under "Manage Filters". If the filter is marked as a favorite it should still be visible which is good however the link should work and not be broken

h3. Workaround
* Restart Jira

ScriptRunner built-in script *Change dashboard or filter ownership* uses ClearCacheEvent as a workaround.
(!) Note that clearing caches may cause performance problems in large data center environments and may result in a cluster outage.
fields.summary: SearchRequestService#updateFilter in Jira's Java API doesn't update cache as it should resulting in broken filter links when updating filter owners until Jira is restarted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When there is a LDAP directory with local group where the group in internal directory does not exist in LDAP, JIRA will synchronize the group to the LDAP. If the LDAP admin creates a new group with the same name in LDAP, JIRA will not create a new entry in cwd_group table which could prevent users in group from being synchronized.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a group in Internal Directory.
# Create a LDAP connection with "Read only, Local group" option
# Add a user from LDAP to the new group.
# Perform full synchronization.
# Create a new group in LDAP with the identical name.
# Try to add a user to the same group again.

Problem mainly happens because there will be 2 entries in the cwd_group:

{code}
10362;"atl04";"atl04";1;1;"2017-09-25 15:55:38.685+00";"2017-09-25 15:55:38.685+00";"";"";"GROUP";10101
10363;"atl04";"atl04";1;0;"2017-09-25 15:55:38.715+00";"2017-09-25 15:55:38.715+00";"";"";"GROUP";1
{code}

We can see that there are 2 entries for the *atl04* group where the top entry from LDAP shows that the group is not a local group and added from LDAP directly. Since the LDAP is configured with "Read only, local group", adding user to the group will fail since JIRA will try to connect to LDAP to add the user in LDAP group rather than adding to the local group. 


h3. Expected Result:

The Group Members from the LDAP side would be sync to JIRA.

h3. Actual Result:

The Group Members are not synced as the member of the group.

h3. Workaround 

If user is using the "Read only, local group" option, updating the *local* entry from 1 to 0 will allow the user to be able to added to the local user.

Eg based on the query above:

{code}
update cwd_group set local = '0' where ID = 'ID of the group';
{code}
fields.summary: Group is not updated in certains scenario

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Follow-up from JRASERVER-62707 regarding *CachedReferences* 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add _INFO_ logging event for cache reset  event and additional _DEBUG_ logging with stackrace to track source the flush event. 
 
h3. Implemented solution
* In fixed JIRA version, there is a logging for cache reset events for *CachedReferences* (same as for JRASERVER-62707):
* Please note that this logging has no performance impact. 
* How to enable logging for cache flush events: 
*# Navigate to Cog Icon > System > Logging and profiling
*# Find *com.atlassian.cache.event* and set it to _INFO_ level
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator for JIRA Datacenter I want to log CachedReferences flush events

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The REST API to add a user to a project role, *add actor users* (POST request /rest/api/2/project/<projectIdOrKey>/role/<ID>, documented on this link: [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.9/]) adds the received username into {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table without converting to internal data representation ('lower_user_name').

This leads to data inconsistency in the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table:
 * The same user can be inserted multiple times if the text case is different in each rest api call issued.
 ** Note that the mixed case username will not be shown in the UI as the original username is shown instead in the JIRA Project Settings --> Users and roles view. (See below additional notes section)

 * It also generates inconsistencies in the JIRA UI as the user will be displayed in the Project Settings --> Users and roles view (http://<HOST>:<PORT>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJECTKEY>/roles) however it will not be possible to delete it.
 ** The only user that will be possible to delete from the JIRA UI will be the one that has the proper user name in lower case in the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table. (See below additional notes section)

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.2.9 (other versions were not testes and could be also affected)

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user with Full name: Esteban Casuscelli and Username: Esteban
 # Create a project with project key: AAAA
 # Issue the curl command below
{code:java}
curl -v  -u jira_admin:Atlassian http://10.125.88.195:8080/rest/api/2/project/AAAA/role/10002 -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{ "user" : ["Esteban"] }'
{code}

 # Check that the user is added as administrator to the project, GOTO http://<HOST>:<PORT>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJECTKEY>/roles
 # Try to delete the user through the JIRA UI by clicking on the delete button.
 # Addtional steps to show the how it generates more inconsistency in the JIRA database and JIRA UI
 ## Run the curl command below
{code:java}
curl -v  -u jira_admin:Atlassian http://10.125.88.195:8080/rest/api/2/project/AAAA/role/10002 -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{ "user" : ["ESTEBAN"] }'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should either
 * Recognise user regardless of the text case and then the {{lower_user_name}} should be inserted into the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table.
 * Deny adding 'non-valid' users to a project role

h3. Actual Results
 * JIRA inserts the received username into {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table without converting to the internal data representation ('lower_user_name').
 ** For each new variation of mixed-case username new user is added to the project roles.

h3. Additional Notes
h4. JIRA UI

If the user is added with a different text case than the respective username in lower case then
 * multiple rows for the same users will be shown in table view
 * it will be no possible to be deleted all those duplicated users
 See screenshot below.
 !projectroleactor_ui.png|thumbnail!

h4. PROJECTROLEACTOR table

Every time the rest api call is issued with a different text case for the same user a new row will be inserted into the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table.
{noformat}
<TBD>
{noformat}
!projectroleactor_db.png|thumbnail!
  
h3. Workaround
h5. To avoid the problem
 * Ensure that when issuing the rest api call the user name is in lower case.eg using example above:
{code:java}
--data '{ "user" : ["esteban"] }'
{code}

h5. To fix inconsistencies in the JIRA UI

Follow the below steps:
 # Identify the users that have mixed case or capitalization in the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table:
{code:java}
select * from projectroleactor where roletype = 'atlassian-user-role-actor' and pid = <PROJECT_ID>;
{code}

 # For each of the rows that have the username in any text case that is not lower case (ROLETYPEPARAMETER column) issue the following DELETE REST API call:
{code:java}
curl -v -u jira_admin:Atlassian http://10.125.88.195:8080/rest/api/2/project/AAAA/role/10002?user=<USERNAME_HERE> -X DELETE -H "Content-Type: application/json"
{code}

 ** Note that <USERNAME_HERE> must have the exact text case as they user identified previously in the {{PROJECTROLEACTOR}} table
fields.summary: REST API 'Add actor users' creates duplicates in roles view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When applying a "non-macro" character formatting applied to a portion of a word: bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, subscript, superscript, monospace in Visual mode, the text formatting looks as if it works but upon saving the comment or clicking on the Visual tab again, the formatting is not saved and the wiki markup will be displayed instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any JIRA Issue
# In visual mode, try typing in for example:
{noformat}*Bold*face
+Under+line
-Strike-Through
{color:#d04437}Color{color}ized{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The parts of the word that has the text formatting applied to them will be correctly rendered.

h3. Actual Results
When the text is saved, it will be displayed like this:
{quote}*Bold*face
+Under+line
-Strike-Through
{color:#d04437}Color{color}ized{quote}
 
h3. Notes
* As we can see from the example above, only the color formatting is working.
* If you type "Boldface" in visual mode manually and apply the text formatting via the UI buttons (eg. clicking on the *B* button) or keyboard shortcuts (eg. Ctrl+B) it will appear correctly in the visual mode but upon saving the results are the same.
fields.summary: Highlighting within a word reverts to wiki markup in the Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The install script for Jira's Azure deployment doesn't properly escape input parameters. If a variable contains a dollar sign, it will be incorrectly evaluated by bash, and the value that ends up in the Jira configuration may not be the value specified by the user.

The install script needs to escape parameters properly so that they are always treated as data, not code.
h3. Environment

Jira Software Data Center on Azure (using the official Azure deployment scripts).
h3. Steps to reproduce

Following the deployment instructions in [atlassian-azure-deployment|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-azure-deployment/overview], deploy a cluster with a parameter containing a dollar sign (_e.g._ the database password).
h3. Expected result

Jira starts up correctly and can access the database (the specified password is output correctly in the {{dbconfig.xml}}).
h3. Actual result

The database password in {{dbconfig.xml}} does not match the input parameter.
h3. Workaround

Manually update the incorrectly created configuration files (_e.g._ SSH into each node, and update {{dbconfig.xml}} with the proper values).
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center Azure templates don't escape deployment parameters properly

fields.description:
To prevent password managers to accidentally change the Mail settings :
 the username and password fields should have different field names

for example:
in the smtp server settings the field username and password  is filled with the account information from the browsers password manager (see screenshot)

 !Screenshot from 2017-09-22 11-10-19.png|thumbnail! 

Suggested change: 
replace field names with : smtp-username and smtp-password


This will prevent the users password manager to insert the stored account information used to log in to JIRA to replace the smtp settings set for JIRA.
fields.summary: Change the username and password field on SMTP settings

fields.description:
I would like to find an easy way to compare original and draft workflows before publishing.

Currently, I can only do: view original.

To compare, I have to
 * export the draft workflow as xml
 * view the original workflow
 * export the original workflow as xml
 * compare (visually) both xml in a text comparator tool.

A link "show difference with original" on the draft, for instance, would be cheap (I guess) and very helpfull.

(in a first version, it would show the difference between the 2 xml (how to compare comlexe structures like workflows otherwise?))
fields.summary: Ease comparison between original and draft workflows

fields.description:
I created a dashboard with a gadget "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" and set it for "Priority vs Status" so that we can see the priorities and status of each Jira bug. 
 * When I click on the total count for P1 bugs, I get both P0 and P1 bugs.
 * When I click on the total count for P2 bugs, I get both P1 and P2 bugs. 
 * When I click on the total count for P3 bugs, I get both P2 and P3 bugs.
 * When I click on the total count for P4 bugs, I get both P3 and P4 bugs.

This seems wrong to me. I should just get a list of the bugs associated with that priority.
fields.summary: Bug: Gadget "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" set for "Priority vs Status" loads issue for two priority together when click on only single priority

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA inefficiently populates _fieldLayoutCache_ due to slow loading of FieldLayoutItems. JIRA loads elements into fieldLayoutCache one by one and at the same time load all related  rows from {{FieldLayoutItem}} table. {{FieldLayoutItem}} table doesn't have index for {{fieldlayout}} column, so loading many row will cause Full-Scan and will be slow. 
Since _fieldLayoutCache_ is used in many places, slow population will cause performance problems, see for example: JRASERVER-29310 and JRASERVER-61166. 

h3. Environment
* Large number of rows in {{fieldlayoutitem}} table - 200k+: 
{code:SQL|borderStyle=solid}
 select count(1) from fieldlayoutitem; 
1355666
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Population of _fieldLayoutCache_ is fast

h3. Actual Results
Population of _fieldLayoutCache_ is slow. 

h3. Notes
* Thread dumps generated during that time will have following common part:
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-359 " #68120 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f7bc03ab800 nid=0x6263 runnable [0x00007f93cc3a3000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at sun.nio.ch.FileDispatcherImpl.read0(Native Method)
...
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingResultSet.next(DelegatingResultSet.java:191)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityListIterator.next(EntityListIterator.java:245)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.EntityListIterator.getCompleteList(EntityListIterator.java:308)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectByAnd(GenericDAO.java:731)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.findByAnd(GenericHelperDAO.java:150)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByAnd(GenericDelegator.java:903)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.findByAnd(GenericDelegator.java:881)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getRelated(GenericDelegator.java:1499)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getRelated(GenericDelegator.java:1429)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.getRelated(GenericValue.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.loadFieldLayoutItems(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:302)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.loadFieldLayout(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:334)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.access$100(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager$FieldLayoutCacheLoader.load(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:426)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager$FieldLayoutCacheLoader.load(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:423)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.getFromLoader(LoadingCache.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.loadValueAndReleaseLock(LoadingCache.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager.getRelevantFieldLayout(AbstractFieldLayoutManager.java:264)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getFieldLayout(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:702)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:586)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.field.DefaultFieldLayoutManager.getUniqueFieldLayouts(DefaultFieldLayoutManager.java:562)
....
{noformat}

* SQL logs will have the following:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
SELECT ID, FIELDLAYOUT, FIELDIDENTIFIER, DESCRIPTION, VERTICALPOSITION, ISHIDDEN, ISREQUIRED, RENDERERTYPE FROM public.fieldlayoutitem WHERE FIELDLAYOUT='10100'"
{code}

h3. Note on fix
Fix in Jira is done by _adding_ the _index_ from the workaround section below. 

h3.Workaround
(!) *Important*: Please validate these changes in a test environment first to ensure that they perform well.
Adding index for {{fieldlayout}} column to the {{fieldlayoutitem}} table. Credit to Dieter Greiner for suggesting a fix 
* Modify  {{entitymodel.xml}}, so JIRA will create index during next restart: 
*# Edit {{entitymodel.xml}} file (<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs/entitymodel.xml) and add section with *idx_fli_fieldlayout*, result should be like this:
{code}
<entity entity-name="FieldLayoutItem" table-name="fieldlayoutitem" package-name="">
...
    <relation type="one" title="Parent" rel-entity-name="FieldLayout">
        <key-map field-name="fieldlayout" rel-field-name="id"/>
    </relation>

    <index name="idx_fli_fieldidentifier">
        <index-field name="fieldidentifier"/>
    </index>

    <!-- added to workaround JRASERVER-66013: -->
    <index name="idx_fli_fieldlayout">
        <index-field name="fieldlayout"/>
    </index>
</entity>
{code}
**# Restart JIRA.
**# Verify the indexes have been added, for example with MySQL:
{code:SQL}
show create table fieldlayoutitem;
{code}
This should show:
{code:SQL}
  KEY `idx_fli_fieldlayout` (`FIELDLAYOUT`)
{code}

* Alternatively you could add the index onto the table manually. 
* Please note that as this is a customisation it's not fully tested, so may cause unintended side-effects. If the modification is applied, it will need to be done after each upgrade as the {{entitymodel.xml}} file will change.
** (!) Please ensure to copy just the modification across during upgrades, not the entire file, as that can cause significant problems (you may overwrite changes in future versions).
fields.summary: JIRA inefficiently populates fieldLayoutCache due to slow loading of FieldLayoutItems

This will give a softer option than making the field Required.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the event that a previous JQL query result is empty, the navigator will show the warning message "No issues were found to match your search" in black font. 

When re-running that query again (or a different one) which will also result in an empty result, the warning message is still kept.

Sometimes it warning message is greyed out to notify the user that the query is running. But occasionally, the 
warning message is kept as is. There is no indication how long the user should wait for the result.

As a user, I expect to see a clear hint if a query is running or is finished.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Change the warning message to reflect what JQL query is JIRA not displaying results for.
fields.summary: Issue navigator should specify what JQL result is it showing results for.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Assignee is shown as "Anonymous" in HipChat notification.

h3. Environment

* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin 7.10.1
* Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core 7.10.1
* HipChat for JIRA 7.10.1
* HipChat (Cloud or Server)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate JIRA with HipChat
# Connect a JIRA project with a HipChat room
# Press Edit button on the setting page and check "Assignee updated"
# Create a user (e.g. "jsmith") on JIRA and give "Assignable User" permission to him on the project
# Change username of the user (e.g. "jsmith" -> "jsmith2")
# Change assignee to "jsmith2" on an issue (e.g. TEST-1) in the project

h3. Expected Results

The notification in the HipChat room should be as follows.

{noformat}
xxxxx assigned jsmith2 to TEST-1: yyyyy
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results

The new assignee was shown as "Anonymous".

{noformat}
xxxxx assigned Anonymous to TEST-1: yyyyy
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Rename the username back to the original one.
fields.summary: Assignee is shown as "Anonymous" in HipChat notification

fields.description:
*Situation:*
 A user created an issue. Everytime someone mention him in a comment, he receives two e-mails. One saying that the issue was commented (because the notifications scheme configuration), and other saying that he was mentioned. It can be annoying.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 1) Configure notifications scheme to send e-mail to reporter when issue is commented
 2) Create an issue as User A
 3) User B adds a comment to the issue mentioning (@userA) User A
 4) User A receives two e-mails

*Expected Result:*
 User A receives one e-mail (take a pick of choosing the comment or the mention)

*Actual Result:*
 User A receives two e-mails (one for the mention, one for the comment)
fields.summary: Prevent double notifications when I'm mentioned in a comment of an issue I reported

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to use partial string match when searching user in assignee field.
This problem happened only in case that JIRA is configured to use DB for searching user instead of in-memory Lucene index.

h3. Environment

The following property is added in {{<JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties}}.
{code}
jira.luceneUserSearcher = false
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the following property to {{<JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties}}
{code}
jira.luceneUserSearcher = false
{code}
# Start JIRA
# Create a user whose full name is "John Smith"
# Give "Assignable User" permission to "John Smith" on an project
# Open an issue in the project
# Press _Assign_ button
# Type "Smith" in the assignee field

h3. Expected Results

The user "John Smith" should be appears in the suggestion in the field.

h3. Actual Results

The user "John Smith" didn't appear in the suggestion. (In case that we type "John", the user was shown in the suggestion.)
 
h3. Notes

* The partial string matching worked on JIRA Server 7.1.2 even though the version still used DB for searching users
* When it comes to large JIRA instances, we still need to use {{jira.luceneUserSearcher = false}} option to avoid some problems like JRASERVER-65057
* Please see [my internal comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66008?focusedCommentId=1619868&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1619868] for the additional information

h3.Workaround

Use in-memory Lucene index for searching users. (Disable {{jira.luceneUserSearcher = false}} option)
fields.summary: Unable to use partial string match when searching user in assignee field
Increase the default session timeout from 300 minutes to 720 minutes.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are unable to choose a date from the Date Picker when choosing to release an unreleased Version while using Japanese or Korean as its default language.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.3.6
* Jira 7.4.0
* Jira 7.5.0
* Jira 8.0.1
* Default Jira language is either Japanese or Korean

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Jira default to Japanese or Korean
# Go to a Software project and click on the Releases tab 
# Select the meatball menu (. . .) on an unreleased version
# Click on Release
# Click on the Calendar icon

h3. Expected Results
A Date Picker that shows a calendar by month

h3. Actual Results
The Date Picker will only show a single row with the words 'undefined' repeated again and again. Can be seen with the attached screenshots {{datepicker_japanese.png}} and {{datepicker_korean.png}}.
h4. Screenshot of Jira in Japanese
!datepicker_japanese.png|thumbnail!  
h4. Screenshot of Jira in Korean
!datepicker_korean.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
There is a feature to manage versions in the Project settings (under _Project setting -> Versions_). The Date Picker when releasing an unreleased Version under that tab works fine.
fields.summary: Date Picker when setting the release date of an unreleased Version shows undefined for Japanese , Korean & Russian language

fields.description: The version of the bundled Atlassian Activity Streams plugin was vulnerable to Improper Access control. This allowed remote authenticated attackers to watch any Confluence page & receive notifications when comments are added to the watched page, and vote & watch JIRA issues that they do not have access to, although they will not receive notifications for the issue, via missing permission checks.  More information about the Atlassian Activity Stream plugin issue see https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2350 .
fields.summary: The bundled Atlassian Activity Streams plugin had Improper Access control inside several rest inline action resource resource - CVE-2017-9506

fields.description:
When creating an automation rule it should verify if the user running the rule has the correct permissions to perform the task.

Currently if the user doesn't have the correct project permissions it just doesn't run the rule and no notice is given.
fields.summary: When creating a Automation Rule in Jira Service Desk Server advise if current user permissions are sufficient.

fields.description:
h3. Project imports fail to identify custom fields that have translations configured
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add translations to custom fields that are in a project that will receive a project import
 # Try to import a project from a XML Backup

h3. Expected Results
 - JIRA should not complain about a custom field not existing.

h3. Actual Results

Jira will display an error message saying that the custom field xxxx of type xxxx is required but was not found in the instance, when it actually exists and it is present on the list of custom fields.
h3. Workaround

Remove the translations from custom fields before importing the project.
fields.summary: Project imports fail to identify custom fields that have translations configured

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When linking an issue to Confluence pages, some of them are shown as "undefined".
(i) This is different bug from JRASERVER-63769 and JRASERVER-65249.

h3. Environment

I reproduced this bug with JIRA Server 7.5.0 + Confluence 6.3.3.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Integrate JIRA with Confluence
# Create "test" space on Confluence
# Open an issue on JIRA and go to _More > Link > Confluence Page > search for a page_
# Search page with the following conditions
#* Keyword: "test"
#* Space: "All Spaces"

h3. Expected Results

Only "test Home" page should be in the results.

h3. Actual Results

"test Home" and "undefined" page were in the results.

 !undefined.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

When JIRA tried to searched the pages on Confluence, the following REST seemed to be called.

{code}
/rest/api/search?cql=text+%7E+%22test%22+AND+type+NOT+IN+%28attachment%2Ccomment%29&limit=10&expand=body
{code}

The REST seemed to obtain not only pages but also spaces.
The CQL should be like the following as JIRA issues should not be linked to Confluence Space but to Confluence Page.

{code}
text ~ "test" AND type NOT IN (attachment,comment,space)
{code}

h3.Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: When linking an issue to Confluence pages, some of them are shown as "undefined"

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When starting up JIRA or following a reindex, at times, JIRA would randomly go to the error page" : <jira base url>:secure/errors.jsp

This error keeps coming up randomly and due to this, it can be confusing as users can assume there is something wrong with JIRA when there's nothing wrong with it.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected Behavior

When JIRA starts for the first time, it should always land correctly on the login page and following a reindex, it should show the page allowing users to acknowledge the reindex result.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA Error Page Prompt

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Cloud storage solutions such as AWS S3 are now widely used by customers as one of the main storage destination. However, JIRA does not have a feature that lets the customer directly backup to a cloud storage solution.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Include a feature that allow users to directly backup into a cloud service provider.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to backup data directly to cloud storage providers
